JSRDotNETSDK Reference

JSRDotNETManager.PulseRepetitionFrequencyNumerator Property

See Also

For pulsers which support the direct setting of the PulseRepetitionFrequency, this property may indicate the numerator used to calculate the actual attainable PRF values. For example, the DPR500 pulsers use a numerator of 12,000,000. The actual attainable PRF values are 12,000,000 / n, where n is an integer. The allow range of n would be indicated by the Min and Max for the PRF. If the min PRF is 184 Hz, and the max is 20,000 Hz, then n could be in the range 12,000,000 / 20,000 = 600 to 12,000,000 / 184 = 65,217. For instruments like the DPR300, which do not support the direct setting of the PRF value, this numerator will return the illegal value of 0. For the DPR300, the index method is used to set PRF.

Namespace: JSRDotNETSDK
Assembly: JSRDotNETSDK (in JSRDotNETSDK.dll)

This language is not supported or no code example is available.

Property Value

(int) the numerator used in calculating attainable PRF values.
